bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, September 3, 1900

div1.p: Lazear reports that Mabel Lazear and the baby are well.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, September 3, 1900
div1.p:
I was glad
to get your letters but
sorry you are having
so much trouble about
the baby. I hope the
hot weather is over
with you and that
there will be no more
trouble. The situation
of the cottage must have
been very unpleasant.

I am delighted that
you have had your
portrait painted. I have
always wanted it
done. I hope I shall
have a permanent
home some day when
it can be hung. I am
very anxious to have
a look at it. Jennie's
portrait of her Mother
was very good indeed.
Some improvements have
been promised for our
cottage here such as
ceilings and a bath room.
At present we use
a shower bath about
a hundred feet away.
I don't think there is much
chance of my getting away until
late in October.

Mabel and the little lady seem to
be getting along nicely. I am
very much relieved that the whole
affair is over safely.

Beverly is rather a pretty place, and
there is a fairly good town library
there which you ought to visit.
The streets are shady and there are
several nice walks. Some of
the country back inland is very
pretty.

I hope the little man will have no
more trouble with his digestion.
When the weather is cool he
ought to be able to eat a good
many things.
